meanings.sent1: After finishing the puzzle, she decided to retransform it for another round of fun.
meanings.sent2: The artist had to retransform the painting multiple times to get it just right.
meanings.sent3: Trying to retransform a cat into a dog would be quite the magical feat!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to retransform the gloomy atmosphere into one of joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The potion had the power to retransform any object into its original form.

meanings.definition: To change back to a previous form or state
meanings.sent1: He needed to retransform the document to its original format before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will retransform into a butterfly after a period of time.
meanings.sent3: It would be interesting to see a superhero movie where the villain tries to retransform into a hero.
meanings.sent4: The old building was retransformed into a modern office space, preserving its historical charm.
meanings.sent5: The magical spell had the power to retransform the cursed prince into his human form.
